```Java
/**
 * Description: This method selects the header accept based on the given array of accepts.
 * It checks if the array is empty, if so, it returns null.
 * For each accept in the array, it parses the media type and checks if it is JSON and not a problem JSON.
 * If it is, it returns a singleton list of the media type.
 * If none of the accepts are JSON, it parses all the media types from the array and returns them.
 *
 * @param accepts An array of accept strings.
 * @return A list of MediaType objects.
 */
public List<MediaType> selectHeaderAccept(String[] accepts) {
    if (accepts == null || accepts.length == 0) {
        return null;
    }
    List<MediaType> mediaTypes = new ArrayList<>();
    for (String accept : accepts) {
        MediaType mediaType = MediaType.parseMediaType(accept);
        if (mediaType.isCompatibleWith(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON) && !mediaType.isProblemJson()) {
            mediaTypes.add(mediaType);
        } else {
            mediaTypes.addAll(Arrays.asList(mediaType));
        }
    }
    return mediaTypes;
}
```

/**
 * Description: This method retrieves grouped processes from the Elasticsearch index.
 * It uses the Elasticsearch aggregation API to group processes by tenant ID and BPMN process ID.
 * Each group is further aggregated to get the top hits (processes) sorted by version in descending order.
 * The method returns a map where the key is a ProcessKey object and the value is a list of ProcessEntity objects.
 * 
 * @param tenantId The ID of the tenant to filter the processes.
 * @param allowedBPMNProcessIds A set of allowed BPMN process IDs to filter the processes.
 * @return A map where the key is a ProcessKey object and the value is a list of ProcessEntity objects.
 * @throws OperateRuntimeException If an IOException occurs during the search operation.
 */
@Override
public Map<ProcessKey, List<ProcessEntity>> getProcessesGrouped(
String tenantId, @Nullable Set<String> allowedBPMNProcessIds)
```

If the delay level is less than 0, it sends the message to the dead letter service. If it's 0, it calculates the delivery attempts and sets the original queue offset. public static byte[] serialize(Set<ByteArrayWrapper> set) {
    if (CollectionUtils.isEmpty(set)) {
        return null;
    }

/**
 * Description: This method is used to fetch the error interval in milliseconds based on the error code.
 * If the error code is Errors.NONE, it returns an empty Optional.
 * If the error code is INVALID_REQUEST, INVALID_RECORD, UNSUPPORTED_VERSION, it sets the push interval to Integer.MAX_VALUE and logs a reason.
 * If the error code is UNKNOWN_SUBSCRIPTION_ID, UNSUPPORTED_COMPRESSION_TYPE, it sets the push interval to 0 and logs the error message.
 * If the error code is TELEMETRY_TOO_LARGE, THROTTLING_QUOTA_EXCEEDED, it sets the push interval to either the provided interval or the default interval and logs the error message.
 * For any other error code, it logs an error and sets the push interval to Integer.MAX_VALUE.
 * Finally, it logs the error code, reason, and push interval and returns the push interval in an Optional.
 *
 * @param errorCode The error code to fetch the interval for.
 * @param intervalMs The interval in milliseconds.
 * @return An Optional containing the push interval in milliseconds.
 */
public static Optional<Integer> maybeFetchErrorIntervalMs(short errorCode, int intervalMs)

/**
 * Description: This method is responsible for shutting down the serviceManager and curatorFramework.
 * It first attempts to stop the serviceManager asynchronously and wait for it to stop within a specified time limit.
 * If this operation times out, it logs an error message.
 * Then it attempts to close the curatorFramework. If this operation fails, it logs an error message.
 * Finally, it logs an informational message and shuts down the LogManager.
 *
 * @throws Exception if there is an error while stopping the serviceManager or closing the curatorFramework.
 */
void shutdown() {
    try {
        serviceManager.stopAsync().awaitTerminated(10, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
    } catch (Exception e) {
        logger.error("Error while stopping the serviceManager: {}", e.getMessage());
    }

    try {
        curatorFramework.close();
    } catch (Exception e) {
        logger.error("Error while closing the curatorFramework: {}", e.getMessage());
    }

    logger.info("Shutting down the LogManager");
    LogManager.shutdown();
}
```

/**
 * Determines the starting offset for a given partition based on the current end offset and the current beginning offset.
 * Filters out stale snapshots and deletes them.
 * Calculates the highest durable offset for the partition by comparing the non-live snapshots with the recovery tasks.
 * If the highest durable offset is less than or equal to 0, it checks the indexer configuration to determine the starting offset.
